name: admin
description: Work with your Power Platform Admin Account.

subcommands.name: help
subcommands.description: Work with your Power Platform Admin Account.

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.description: List all environments from your tenant

params.name: --organization-id
params.description: List all environments that contain given string in their organization id.

params.name: --type
params.description: List all environments with the given type.

params.name: --name
params.description: List all environments that contain given string in their name.

params.name: --environment
params.description: List all environments that contain given string in their name or id.

params.name: --json
params.description: Show results in raw JSON format.

subcommands.name: create
subcommands.description: Creates a Dataverse database in your tenant.

params.name: --type
params.description: Sets the environment Type.

params.name: --currency
params.description: Sets the currency used for your environment. [defaults to USD]

params.name: --domain
params.description: The domain name is part of the environment URL. If domain name is already in use, a numeric value will be appended to the domain name. Eg: If 'contoso' is already in use, then the environment URL will be updated to https://contoso0.crm.dynamics.com.

params.name: --name
params.description: Sets the name of the environment.

params.name: --max-async-wait-time
params.description: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. Default value is 60 minutes

params.name: --templates
params.description: Sets Dynamics365 app that needs to be deployed. [passed as comma separated values] e.g : -tm 'D365_Sample, D365_Sales'

params.name: --team-id
params.description: Team Id as Guid

params.name: --language
params.description: Sets the language used for your environment. [defaults to English]

params.name: --async
params.description: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false.

params.name: --region
params.description: Sets the environment's region name. [defaults to unitedstates]

params.name: --input-file
params.description: The verb arguments to be passed in a .json input file. Eg: 'name' : 'contoso'. The arguments passed through command-line will take precedence over arguments from the .json input file.

subcommands.name: backup
subcommands.description: Takes a manual backup of your environment.

params.name: --label
params.description: Sets the backup label as provided.

params.name: --environment
params.description: Environment URL or ID of the Environment that requires backup.

subcommands.name: delete
subcommands.description: Deletes Environment from your tenant

params.name: --max-async-wait-time
params.description: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. Default value is 60 minutes.

params.name: --async
params.description: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false.

params.name: --environment
params.description: Environment URL or ID of the Environment that needs to be deleted from your tenant.

subcommands.name: reset
subcommands.description: Reset environment from your tenant

params.name: --max-async-wait-time
params.description: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. Default value is 60 minutes.

params.name: --currency
params.description: Sets the currency used for your environment. [defaults to USD]

params.name: --domain
params.description: The domain name is part of the environment URL. If domain name is already in use, a numeric value will be appended to the domain name. Eg: If 'contoso' is already in use, then the environment URL will be updated to https://contoso0.crm.dynamics.com.

params.name: --name
params.description: Sets the name of the environment.

params.name: --templates
params.description: Sets Dynamics365 app that needs to be deployed. [passed as comma separated values] e.g : -tm 'D365_Sample, D365_Sales'

params.name: --environment
params.description: URL or ID of the Environment that needs to be reset.

params.name: --language
params.description: Sets the language used for your environment. [defaults to English]

params.name: --purpose
params.description: Sets the description used to associate the environment with a specific intent.

params.name: --async
params.description: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false.

params.name: --input-file
params.description: The verb arguments to be passed in a .json input file. Eg: 'name' : 'contoso'. The arguments passed through command-line will take precedence over arguments from the .json input file.

subcommands.name: list-backups
subcommands.description: Lists all backups of your environment.

params.name: --environment
params.description: List all environments that contains given string in their Environment ID or URL.

subcommands.name: restore
subcommands.description: Restores an environment to a given backup.

params.name: --source-env
params.description: Environment URL or ID pac of the source environment required for restore.

params.name: --target-env
params.description: Environment URL or ID of the target environment required for restore. This would default to source URL/ID if not provided.

params.name: --selected-backup
params.description: DateTime of the backup in 'mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm' format OR string 'latest'.

params.name: --name
params.description: Optional name of the restored environment.

params.name: --async
params.description: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false.

params.name: --max-async-wait-time
params.description: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. Default value is 60 minutes.

subcommands.name: copy
subcommands.description: Copy Source Environment to Destination Environment

params.name: --source-env
params.description: Environment URL or ID of the source environment that is being copied

params.name: --target-env
params.description: Environment URL or ID of the target environment

params.name: --name
params.description: Name of the target environment

params.name: --type
params.description: Values: MinimalCopy, FullCopy

params.name: --async
params.description: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false.

params.name: --max-async-wait-time
params.description: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. Default value is 60 minutes.

subcommands.name: status
subcommands.description: This command will list the status of all the operations in progress.

subcommands.name: assign-user
subcommands.description: Assign a user to a target environment.

params.name: --environment
params.description: ID or URL of the environment to assign a user to.

params.name: --user
params.description: Object ID or UPN of AAD user to be assigned to the environment or Application ID if assigning an Application User.

params.name: --role
params.description: Name or ID of security role to be applied to user

params.name: --application-user
params.description: Specifies whether the input user is an application user. If business unit is not specified the application user will be added to the authenticated users business unit.

params.name: --business-unit
params.description: ID of business unit to associate application user with.

params.name: --async
params.description: Optional boolean argument to run pac verbs asynchronously, defaults to false.

subcommands.name: assign-group
subcommands.description: Assign group to target Dataverse environment with specified security role.

params.name: --environment
params.description: ID or URL of the environment to assign a user to.

params.name: --group
params.description: AAD object id of group to assign to target Dataverse environment.

params.name: --group-name
params.description: Name of group/team that will created in Dataverse.

params.name: --role
params.description: Name or ID of security role to be applied to user.

params.name: --team-type
params.description: Type of team. Values: Owner, Access, AadSecurityGroup, AadOfficeGroup

params.name: --membership-type
params.description: Team membership type. Values: MembersAndGuests, Members, Owners, Guests

params.name: --business-unit
params.description: ID of business unit to associate application user with.

subcommands.name: list-app-templates
subcommands.description: Lists all supported Dataverse database templates of model-driven apps in Dynamics 365.

params.name: --region
params.description: Sets the environment's region name. [defaults to unitedstates]

name: application
description: Commands for listing and installing available Dataverse applications from AppSource.

subcommands.name: help
subcommands.description: Commands for listing and installing available Dataverse applications from AppSource.

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.description: List available Dataverse applications from AppSource

params.name: --installState
params.description: Filter by application install state. Values: NotInstalled, Installed, All

params.name: --output
params.description: Location of the JSON file to be created with list of the Dataverse applications from AppSource

params.name: --environment
params.description: List available Dataverse applications for given environment (by id or url); if not specified, list all applications in the tenant

subcommands.name: install
subcommands.description: Installs Dataverse application to given environment

params.name: --application-name
params.description: Unique name of the application that will be installed to target environment

params.name: --application-list
params.description: Location of the JSON file with list of the Dataverse applications from AppSource to be installed

params.name: --environment
params.description: List available Dataverse applications for given environment (by id or url); if not specified, list all applications in the tenant

name: auth
description: Manage how you authenticate to various services.

subcommands.name: help
subcommands.description: Manage how you authenticate to various services.

subcommands.name: name
subcommands.description: Name or rename an existing authentication profile.

params.name: --index
params.description: The index of the profile to be named/renamed

params.name: --name
params.description: The name you want to give to this authentication profile (maximum 30 characters)

subcommands.name: create
subcommands.description: Create and store authentication profiles on this computer.

params.name: --name
params.description: The name you want to give to this authentication profile (maximum 30 characters)

params.name: --url
params.description: The resource URL to connect to

params.name: --username
params.description: Optional: The username to authenticate with; shows AAD dialog if not specified

params.name: --password
params.description: Optional: The password to authenticate with

params.name: --applicationId
params.description: Optional: The application id to authenticate with

params.name: --clientSecret
params.description: Optional: The client secret to authenticate with

params.name: --certificateDiskPath
params.description: Optional: The certificate disk path to authenticate with

params.name: --certificatePassword
params.description: Optional: The certificate password to authenticate with

params.name: --tenant
params.description: Tenant id if using application id/client secret or application id/client certificate.

params.name: --cloud
params.description: Optional: The cloud instance to authenticate with Values: Public, UsGov, UsGovHigh, UsGovDod, Mooncake

params.name: --managedIdentity
params.description: Use Azure Managed Identity.

params.name: --deviceCode
params.description: Use the AAD DeviceCode flow for interactive login.

params.name: --environment
params.description: Default environment (id, url, unique name or partial name)

subcommands.name: select
subcommands.description: Select which authentication profile should be active.

params.name: --index
params.description: The index of the profile to be active

params.name: --name
params.description: The name of the profile to be active

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.description: List the authentication profiles stored on this computer.

subcommands.name: clear
subcommands.description: Clear all authentication profiles stored on this computer.

subcommands.name: delete
subcommands.description: Delete a particular authentication profile.

params.name: --index
params.description: The index of the profile to be deleted

params.name: --name
params.description: The name of the profile to be active

subcommands.name: update
subcommands.description: Update name or target environment of an existing authentication profile.

params.name: --index
params.description: The index of the profile to be named/renamed

params.name: --name
params.description: The name you want to give to this authentication profile (maximum 30 characters)

params.name: --environment
params.description: Default environment (id, url, unique name or partial name)

subcommands.name: help
subcommands.description: Operating with Power Apps .msapp files.

subcommands.name: unpack
subcommands.description: (Preview) Extract an msapp file into sources

params.name: --msapp
params.description: Path to .msapp file

params.name: --sources
params.description: Directory to sources to be unpacked

subcommands.name: create

params.name: --msapp

params.name: --connector-id
params.description: The ID of the Connector from which the Power App will be generated

params.name: --connector-display-name
params.description: The display name of the Connector from which the Power App will be generated

params.name: --environment
params.description: The target Environment ID.  Default value is the environment of your currently active Dataverse Auth Profile.

subcommands.name: pack
subcommands.description: (Preview) Pack sources into an msapp file

params.name: --msapp

params.name: --sources

params.description: The filename and path to read the the Connector's API Properties file.

params.description: The filename and path to read the the Connector's OpenApiDefinition.

subcommands.description: (Preview) Download a Connector's OpenApiDefinition and API Properties file

params.name: --environment

name: data
description: Import and export data from Dataverse.

subcommands.name: help
subcommands.description: Import and export data from Dataverse.

subcommands.name: export
subcommands.description: Export data

params.name: --schemaFile
params.description: Schema file name. It can be created using Configuration Migration Tool.

params.name: --environment
params.description: Environment (id, org id, url, unique name or partial name).

params.name: --verbose
params.description: Output more diagnostic information during data import/export.

params.name: --dataFile
params.description: File name for data zip file. Default data.zip.

params.name: --overwrite
params.description: Allow overwrite output data file if it already exists.

subcommands.name: import
subcommands.description: Import data

params.name: --environment
params.description: Environment (id, org id, url, unique name or partial name).

params.name: --verbose
params.description: Output more diagnostic information during data import/export.

params.name: --data
params.description: Zip file or directory name with data for import.

name: modelbuilder
description: Code Generator for Dataverse APIs and Tables.

subcommands.name: help
subcommands.description: Code Generator for Dataverse APIs and Tables.

subcommands.name: build
subcommands.description: Builds a code model for Dataverse APIs and Tables

params.name: --generateActions
params.description: When set, Emits message classes as part of code generation.

params.name: --outdirectory
params.description: Write Directory for entity, message and optionset files.

params.name: --namespace
params.description: The namespace for the generated code.  The default namespace is the global namespace.

params.name: --emitfieldsclasses
params.description: Generate a constants structure that contains all of the field names by entity at the time of code generation.

params.name: --language
params.description: The language to use for the generated proxy code.  This can be either 'CS' or 'VB'.  The default language is 'CS'.

params.name: --suppressINotifyPattern
params.description: When enabled, does not write the INotify wrappers for properties and classes.

params.name: --optionsetstypesfolder
params.description: Folder name that will contain messages.  default is OptionSets.

params.name: --writesettingsTemplateFile
params.description: When Set, writes a settings file out to the output directory with the current passed settings or default settings.

params.name: --serviceContextName
params.description: The name for the generated service context. If a value is passed in, it will be used for the Service Context.  If not, no Service Context will be generated. (alias: -sctx)

params.name: --settingsTemplateFile
params.description: Contains Settings to be used for this run of the Dataverse Model Builder, overrides any duplicate parameters on command line.  Cannot be set when --writesettingstemplate is used.

params.name: --messagestypesfolder
params.description: Folder name that will contain messages.  default is Messages.

params.name: --entitytypesfolder
params.description: Folder name that will contain entities. default is Entities.

params.name: --suppressGeneratedCodeAttribute
params.description: When set, this suppress all generated objects being tagged with the code generation engine and version.

params.name: --generateGlobalOptionSets
params.description: Emit all Global OptionSets, note: if an entity contains a reference to a global optionset, it will be emitted even if this switch is not present.

params.name: --entitynamesfilter
params.description: Filters the list of entities are retrieved when reading data from Dataverse. Passed in as a semicolon separated list.  Using the form <entitylogicalname>;<entitylogicalname>

params.name: --messagenamesfilter
params.description: Filters the list of messages that are retrieved when reading data from Dataverse. Passed in as a semicolon separated list, required messages (Create, Update, Delete, Retrieve, RetrieveMultiple, Associate and Disassociate) are always included. An * can be used to proceed or trail an message allowing for all messages starting with or ending with a string.  Using the form <messagename>;<messagename>.

subcommands.name: help
subcommands.description: Work with your Dataverse Organization.

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.description: Lists all of the Dataverse Organizations the user has access to.

params.name: --filter
params.description: Show only environments containing filter criteria.

subcommands.name: who
subcommands.description: Displays information about the current Dataverse Organization.

params.name: --json
params.description: Show results in raw JSON format.

subcommands.name: select
subcommands.description: Select default organization for current authentication profile.

params.name: --environment
params.description: Default environment (id, url, unique name or partial name).

name: package
description: Commands for working with Dataverse package projects.

subcommands.name: help
subcommands.description: Commands for working with Dataverse package projects.

subcommands.name: add-reference
subcommands.description: Adds reference to Dataverse solution project

params.name: --path
params.description: The path to the referenced Dataverse solution project

params.name: --import-order
params.description: A whole number that indicates the order to insert this item into the final ImportConfig.xml file at build time. Negative numbers are inserted before existing elements. Positive numbers are added after existing elements.

params.name: --publish-workflows-activate-plugins
params.description: Explicitly indicates whether to publish the workflows and activate plug-ins when this solution is imported. Values: true, false

params.name: --overwrite-unmanaged-customizations
params.description: Explicitly indicates whether to overwrite unmanaged customizations when this solution is imported. Values: true, false

params.name: --import-mode
params.description: Explicitly specifies the required mode when importing this solution. Values: sync, async

params.name: --missing-dependency-behavior
params.description: Specifies the behavior on import when a dependency of this solution is missing from the target environment. Values: skip, fault

params.name: --dependency-overrides
params.description: A semicolon delimited list of overrides. This value overrides any dependency information encoded in the solution's metadata. Each override should be in the format: `<uniquename>:<minVersion>:<maxVersion>`. Where the minVersion and maxVersion is optional but should be in .Net version format syntax.

subcommands.name: add-external-package
subcommands.description: Adds a package that is external to the Dataverse solution system to a PD Package project

params.name: --path
params.description: Path to the external package.

params.name: --package-type
params.description: The type of the package being added. e.g. 'xpp' for FnO packages.

params.name: --import-order
params.description: A whole number that indicates the order to insert this item into the final ImportConfig.xml file at build time. Negative numbers are inserted before existing elements. Positive numbers are added after existing elements.

params.name: --skip-validation
params.description: Adds the item to the project file even if the file does not exist or appears to be invalid. Note, this will not affect any validation that is performed by MSBuild.

subcommands.name: init
subcommands.description: Initializes a directory with a new Dataverse package project

params.name: --outputDirectory
params.description: Output directory.

params.name: --package-name
params.description: Sets the default name of the package. Applies to the generation of ImportExtension.GetNameOfImport.

subcommands.name: show
subcommands.description: Shows details of Dataverse package

params.name: --package
params.description: Path to a package dll or zip file with a package.

params.name: --logFile
params.description: Log file path.

params.name: --verbose
params.description: Emit Verbose logs to the log outputs.

subcommands.name: deploy
subcommands.description: Deploys package to Dataverse

params.name: --logFile
params.description: Log file path.

params.name: --logConsole
params.description: Output log to console.

params.name: --package
params.description: Path to a package dll or zip file with a package.

params.name: --settings
params.description: Runtime Package Settings that are passed to the package that is being deployed.  The format of the string must be `key=value|key=value`.

params.name: --verbose
params.description: Emit Verbose logs to the log outputs.

subcommands.name: add-solution
subcommands.description: Adds a prebuilt Dataverse solution file to a PD Package project

params.name: --path
params.description: Path to the Dataverse solution file (must be *.zip)

params.name: --import-order
params.description: A whole number that indicates the order to insert this item into the final ImportConfig.xml file at build time. Negative numbers are inserted before existing elements. Positive numbers are added after existing elements.

params.name: --skip-validation
params.description: Adds the item to the project file even if the file does not exist or appears to be invalid. Note, this will not affect any validation that is performed by MSBuild.

params.name: --publish-workflows-activate-plugins
params.description: Explicitly indicates whether to publish the workflows and activate plug-ins when this solution is imported. Values: true, false

params.name: --overwrite-unmanaged-customizations
params.description: Explicitly indicates whether to overwrite unmanaged customizations when this solution is imported. Values: true, false

params.name: --import-mode
params.description: Explicitly specifies the required mode when importing this solution. Values: sync, async

params.name: --missing-dependency-behavior
params.description: Specifies the behavior on import when a dependency of this solution is missing from the target environment. Values: skip, fault

params.name: --dependency-overrides
params.description: A semicolon delimited list of overrides. This value overrides any dependency information encoded in the solution's metadata. Each override should be in the format: `<uniquename>:<minVersion>:<maxVersion>`. Where the minVersion and maxVersion is optional but should be in .Net version format syntax.

name: paportal
description: Commands for working with Power Pages website.

params.name: --excludeEntities

name: pcf
description: Commands for working with Power Apps component framework projects.

subcommands.name: help
subcommands.description: Commands for working with Power Apps component framework projects.

subcommands.name: init
subcommands.description: Initializes a directory with a new Power Apps component framework project

params.name: --template
params.description: Choose a template for the component. Values: field, dataset.

params.name: --framework
params.description: The rendering framework for control. Default value is 'none'. Values: none, react.

params.name: --outputDirectory
params.description: Output directory.

params.name: --name
params.description: The name for the component.

params.name: --namespace
params.description: The namespace for the component.

params.name: --run-npm-install
params.description: Auto run 'npm install' after the control is created. Default value is 'false'.

subcommands.name: push
subcommands.description: Import the Power Apps component framework project into the current Dataverse Organization

params.name: --force-import
params.description: Force a full update of the control.

params.name: --verbosity
params.description: Verbosity level for MSBuild when building the temporary solution wrapper. Values: minimal, normal, detailed, diagnostic.

params.name: --publisher-prefix
params.description: Customization prefix value for the Dataverse solution publisher.

subcommands.name: version
subcommands.description: Patch version for controls

params.name: --updatetarget
params.description: Specify which target manifest needs to be updated. Values: build, project

params.name: --patchversion
params.description: Patch version for controls.

params.name: --path
params.description: Absolute/Relative path of the 'ControlManifest.xml' for updating.

params.name: --strategy
params.description: Updates patch version for 'ControlManifest.xml' files using specified strategy. If using gittags, set personal access token in the following environment variable 'PacCli.PAT'. Values: gittags, filetracking, manifest.

params.name: --filename
params.description: Tracker CSV file name to be used when using filetracking as a strategy. Default value is ControlsStateVersionInfo.csv.

params.name: --allmanifests
params.description: Updates patch version for all 'ControlManifest.xml' files.

subcommands.name: help
subcommands.description: Work with Pipelines.

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.description: List Pipelines

params.name: --pipeline
params.description: Pipeline name or id for which show list of details such as deployment stages.

subcommands.name: deploy

params.name: --stageId
params.description: Deployment Stage Id

params.name: --environment

params.name: --currentVersion
params.description: Current solution version

params.name: --newVersion
params.description: New solution version

params.name: --wait
params.description: Wait until deployment finishes

name: plugin
description: Commands for working with Dataverse plug-in class library.

subcommands.name: push
subcommands.description: Import plug-in into Dataverse.

params.name: --configuration
params.description: Build configuration. Default: Debug.

params.name: --type
params.description: Type of item if not specified explicitly through --pluginFile. Default: Nuget Values: Nuget, Assembly.

params.name: --pluginFile
params.description: File name of plug-in assembly or plug-in package.

params.name: --pluginId
params.description: Id of plug-in assembly or plug-in package.

subcommands.name: init
subcommands.description: Initializes a directory with a new Dataverse plug-in class library.

params.name: --outputDirectory
params.description: Output directory

params.name: --signing-key-file-path
params.description: Relative path to the Dataverse plug-in assembly originator key file for signing.

params.name: --skip-signing
params.description: Skip plug-in assembly signing which gives plug-in assembly strong name. Default value is 'false'

params.name: --author
params.description: Author(s) of the Dataverse Plug-in Package.

name: solution
description: Commands for working with Dataverse solution projects.

subcommands.name: help
subcommands.description: Commands for working with Dataverse solution projects.

subcommands.name: add-solution-component
subcommands.description: Add solution component(s) to the target unmanaged solution in Dataverse.

params.name: --environment
params.description: Environment URL or ID of the target environment.

params.name: --component
params.description: The schema name or ID of the component to add to the target solution.

params.name: --componentType
params.description: The value that represents the solution component that you are adding.

params.name: --solutionUniqueName
params.description: Name of the solution.

params.name: --AddRequiredComponents
params.description: Indicates whether other solution components that are required by the solution component that you are adding should also be added to the unmanaged solution.

subcommands.name: online-version
subcommands.description: Sets version for solution loaded in Dataverse.

params.name: --solution-version
params.description: Specify the solution version number.

params.name: --solution-name
params.description: Name of the solution.

subcommands.name: delete
subcommands.description: Delete solution from Dataverse in the current Environment.

params.name: --solution-name
params.description: Name of the solution.

subcommands.name: clone
subcommands.description: Create a solution project based on an existing solution in your Organization

params.name: --processCanvasApps
params.description: (Preview) Pack/unpack any Canvas apps (.msapp) while processing the solution. default: false.

params.name: --async
params.description: Exports solution asynchronously.

params.name: --include
params.description: Which settings should be included in the solution being exported. Values: autonumbering, calendar, customization, emailtracking, externalapplications, general, isvconfig, marketing, outlooksynchronization, relationshiproles, sales

params.name: --outputDirectory
params.description: Output directory.

params.name: --name
params.description: The name of the solution to be exported.

params.name: --max-async-wait-time
params.description: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. Default value is 60 minutes.

params.name: --packagetype
params.description: Specifies the extraction type for the solution. Can be: 'Unmanaged', 'Managed' or 'Both'; default: 'Both'.

subcommands.name: add-license
subcommands.description: Add license and plan info to solution

params.name: --planMappingFile
params.description: License plan mapping file in CSV format; expected columns: Service ID, Component name.

params.name: --planDefinitionFile
params.description: License plan definition file in CSV format; expected columns: Service ID, Display name, More info URL.

subcommands.name: import
subcommands.description: Import the solution into Dataverse.

params.name: --activate-plugins
params.description: Activate plug-ins and workflows on the solution.

params.name: --path
params.description: Path to solution zip file. If not specified, assumes the current folder is a cdsproj project.

params.name: --convert-to-managed
params.description: Convert as Managed Solution.

params.name: --import-as-holding
params.description: Import the solution as a holding solution.

params.name: --async
params.description: Imports solution asynchronously.

params.name: --force-overwrite
params.description: Force an overwrite of unmanaged customizations.

params.name: --publish-changes
params.description: Publish your changes upon a successful import.

params.name: --max-async-wait-time
params.description: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. Default value is 60 minutes.

params.name: --settings-file
params.description: The .json file with the deployment settings for connection references and environment variables.

params.name: --skip-dependency-check
params.description: Skip dependency check against dependencies flagged as product update.

subcommands.name: pack
subcommands.description: Package solution components on local filesystem into solution.zip (SolutionPackager)

params.name: --errorlevel
params.description: Minimum logging level for log output [Verbose|Info|Warning|Error|Off]; default: Info.

params.name: --localize
params.description: Extract or merge all string resources into .resx files.

params.name: --useLcid
params.description: Use LCID's (1033) rather than ISO codes (en-US) for language files.

params.name: --allowWrite
params.description: Dictates if write operations may occur; default: false.

params.name: --processCanvasApps
params.description: (Preview) Pack/unpack any Canvas apps (.msapp) while processing the solution. default: false.

params.name: --useUnmanagedFileForMissingManaged
params.description: Use the same XML source file when packaging for Managed and only Unmanaged XML file is found; applies to AppModuleSiteMap, AppModuleMap, FormXml files.

params.name: --sourceLoc
params.description: Generates a template resource file. Valid only on Extract. Possible Values are auto or an LCID/ISO code of the language you wish to export. When Present, this will extract the string resources from the given locale as a neutral .resx. If auto or just the long or short form of the switch is specified the base locale for the solution will be used.

params.name: --packagetype
params.description: When unpacking/extracting, use to specify dual Managed and Unmanaged operation. When packing, use to specify Managed or Unmanaged from a previous unpack 'Both'. Can be: 'Unmanaged', 'Managed' or 'Both'; default: 'Unmanaged'.

params.name: --disablePluginRemap
params.description: Disabled plug-in fully qualified type name remapping. default: false.

params.name: --allowDelete
params.description: Dictates if delete operations may occur; default: false.

params.name: --log
params.description: The path to the log file.

params.name: --map
params.description: The full path to a mapping xml file from which to read component folders to pack.

params.name: --clobber
params.description: Enables that files marked read-only can be deleted or overwritten; default: false.

params.name: --zipfile
params.description: The full path to the solution ZIP file.

params.name: --folder
params.description: The path to the root folder on the local filesystem. When unpacking/extractins, this will be written to, when packing this will be read from.

params.name: --singleComponent
params.description: Only perform action on a single component type [WebResource|Plugin|Workflow|None]; default: None.

subcommands.name: version
subcommands.description: Update build or revision version for solution

params.name: --filename
params.description: Tracker CSV file name to be used when using filetracking as a strategy. Default value is ControlsStateVersionInfo.csv.

params.name: --revisionversion
params.description: Revision version for solution.

params.name: --strategy
params.description: Updates build version for 'solution.xml' file using specified strategy. If using gittags, set personal access token in the following environment variable 'PacCli.PAT'. Values: gittags, filetracking, solution.

params.name: --buildversion
params.description: Build version for solution.

subcommands.name: export
subcommands.description: Export a solution from Dataverse.

params.name: --async
params.description: Exports solution asynchronously.

params.name: --managed
params.description: Whether the solution should be exported as a managed solution.

params.name: --include
params.description: Which settings should be included in the solution being exported. Values: autonumbering, calendar, customization, emailtracking, externalapplications, general, isvconfig, marketing, outlooksynchronization, relationshiproles, sales

params.name: --path
params.description: Path where the exported solution zip file will be written.

params.name: --overwrite
params.description: The exported solution file can overwrite the solution zip file on the local file system.

params.name: --name
params.description: The name of the solution to be exported.

params.name: --max-async-wait-time
params.description: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. Default value is 60 minutes.

subcommands.name: add-reference
subcommands.description: Adds a reference from the project in the current directory to the project at 'path'

params.name: --path
params.description: The path to the referenced project.

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.description: List all Solutions from the current Dataverse Organization

params.name: --environment
params.description: The target Environment ID or URL. Default value is the environment of your currently active Dataverse Auth Profile.

params.name: --json
params.description: Show results in raw JSON format.

subcommands.name: upgrade
subcommands.description: Option to stage the Dataverse solution for upgrade

params.name: --max-async-wait-time
params.description: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. Default value is 60 minutes.

params.name: --async
params.description: Upgrades solution asynchronously.

params.name: --solution-name
params.description: Name of the solution.

subcommands.name: create-settings
subcommands.description: Create a settings file from solution zip or solution folder.

params.name: --settings-file
params.description: The .json file with the deployment settings for connection references and environment variables.

params.name: --solution-folder
params.description: Path to the local, unpacked solution folder: either the root of the 'Other/Solution.xml' file or a folder with a .cdsproj file.

params.name: --solution-zip
params.description: Path to solution zip file.

subcommands.name: check
subcommands.description: Upload a Dataverse Solution project to run against the Power Apps Checker Service

params.name: --ruleSet
params.description: Select a rule set that will be executed as part of this build. Values: A valid Guid, 'AppSource Certification', 'solution Checker' (default).

params.name: --geo
params.description: Which geographical instance of the Power Apps Checker service to use. Values: PreviewUnitedStates, UnitedStates, Europe, Asia, Australia, Japan, India, Canada, SouthAmerica, UnitedKingdom, France, Germany, UnitedArabEmirates, Switzerland, USGovernment, USGovernmentL4, USGovernmentL5DoD, China

params.name: --customEndpoint
params.description: Specify a custom URL as Power Apps Checker endpoint.

params.name: --path
params.description: Path where the to-be-checked solution zip file(s) exist; path can contain glob/wildcard characters.

params.name: --solutionUrl
params.description: SAS Uri pointing to solution.zip to be analyzed.

params.name: --ruleLevelOverride
params.description: Path to a file containing a JSON array rules and levels to override.  Accepted values for OverrideLevel are: Critical, High, Medium, Low, Informational. Example: ['Id':'meta-remove-dup-reg','OverrideLevel':'Medium','Id':'il-avoid-specialized-update-ops','OverrideLevel':'Medium'].

params.name: --excludedFiles
params.description: Exclude Files from the Analysis. Pass as comma-separated values.

params.name: --outputDirectory
params.description: Output directory.

subcommands.name: init
subcommands.description: Initializes a directory with a new Dataverse solution project

params.name: --publisher-prefix
params.description: Customization prefix value for the Dataverse solution publisher.

params.name: --outputDirectory
params.description: Output directory.

params.name: --publisher-name
params.description: Name of the Dataverse solution publisher.

subcommands.name: unpack
subcommands.description: Extract solution components from solution.zip onto local filesystem (SolutionPackager)

params.name: --errorlevel
params.description: Minimum logging level for log output [Verbose|Info|Warning|Error|Off]; default: Info.

params.name: --localize

params.name: --packagetype

params.name: --disablePluginRemap
params.description: Disabled plug-in fully qualified type name remapping. default: false.

params.name: --allowDelete

params.name: --log

params.name: --zipfile

params.name: --folder

params.name: --singleComponent
params.description: Only perform action on a single component type [WebResource|Plugin|Workflow|None]; default: None.

subcommands.name: publish
subcommands.description: Publishes all customizations

params.name: --max-async-wait-time
params.description: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. Default value is 60 minutes.

params.name: --async
params.description: Publishes all customizations asynchronously.

subcommands.name: sync
subcommands.description: Sync the current Dataverse solution project to the current state of the solution in your Organization.

params.name: --solution-folder
params.description: Path to the local, unpacked solution folder: either the root of the 'Other/Solution.xml' file or a folder with a .cdsproj file.

params.name: --async
params.description: Exports solution asynchronously.

params.name: --include
params.description: Which settings should be included in the solution being exported. Values: autonumbering, calendar, customization, emailtracking, externalapplications, general, isvconfig, marketing, outlooksynchronization, relationshiproles, sales

params.name: --max-async-wait-time
params.description: Max asynchronous wait time in minutes. Default value is 60 minutes.

params.name: --processCanvasApps
params.description: (Preview) Pack/unpack any Canvas apps (.msapp) while processing the solution. default: false.

params.name: --packagetype

subcommands.name: help
subcommands.description: Manage telemetry settings.

subcommands.name: status
subcommands.description: Show the current status of telemetry

subcommands.name: enable
subcommands.description: Choose to send usage information to help Microsoft improve this product

subcommands.name: disable
subcommands.description: Choose to not send usage information to help Microsoft improve this product

name: tool
description: Power Platform tools that can be installed and launched.

subcommands.name: help
subcommands.description: Power Platform tools that can be installed and launched.

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.description: List the launchable tools and their local install state and version.

subcommands.name: prt
subcommands.description: Launch Plug-in Registration Tool (PRT)

params.name: --update
params.description: Update tool to latest available version from nuget.org.

params.name: --clear
params.description: Clear tool from local file cache.

subcommands.name: pd
subcommands.description: Launch Package Deployer (PD)

params.name: --update
params.description: Update tool to latest available version from nuget.org.

params.name: --clear
params.description: Clear tool from local file cache.

subcommands.name: cmt
subcommands.description: Launch Configuration Migration Tool (CMT)

params.name: --update
params.description: Update tool to latest available version from nuget.org.

params.name: --clear
params.description: Clear tool from local file cache.

name: virtual-agent
description: Commands for working with Power Virtual Agent bots

subcommands.name: help
subcommands.description: Commands for working with Power Virtual Agent bots

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.description: List of Virtual Agents in current or target Dataverse environment.

params.name: --environment
params.description: The target Environment ID or URL.  Default value is the environment of your currently active Dataverse Auth Profile.

name: install
description: Install 'latest' or a specified version of the Microsoft PowerApps CLI

name: use
